title: sdp
author: sdp
content: Is there a Bitcoin - P2P Marketplace application?  One that runs on its own and connects to peers rather than relying on some central server?  Really the Marketplace board is not all that great of an interface for buying things online.  I'd lilke an interface that looks like e-bay but with BTC prices.  Some escrow system would be good too.  I'm not asking much, just a pointer to it if it already exists.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: I know there is such a marketplace like what you’re trying to identify, but I really have forgotten the name of it. It's something marketplace. Maybe other members could give it?I remember posting a Gunbot ad there but it didn't receive any exposure. So maybe someone can point to it or something.

comments.body: Quote from: sdp on October 19, 2022, 03:46:15 PMIs there a Bitcoin - P2P Marketplace application?  One that runs on its own and connects to peers rather than relying on some central server?  Really the Marketplace board is not all that great of an interface for buying things online.  I'd lilke an interface that looks like e-bay but with BTC prices.  Some escrow system would be good too.  I'm not asking much, just a pointer to it if it already exists.There used to be one [OpenBazaar.org - archived version] that almost ticked all the boxes, but their website is inaccessible... Having said that, I checked their "subreddit page" and it looks like new developers have taken over some of the duties to "come up with a new version": mobazha.org [note: I prefer to not vouch, so DYOR]

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.created_time: October 26, 2022, 06:58:15 PMLast edit: October 29, 2022, 08:29:31 PM by dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: sdp on October 19, 2022, 03:46:15 PMIs there a Bitcoin - P2P Marketplace application?  One that runs on its own and connects to peers rather than relying on some central server?  Really the Marketplace board is not all that great of an interface for buying things online.  I'd lilke an interface that looks like e-bay but with BTC prices.  Some escrow system would be good too.  I'm not asking much, just a pointer to it if it already exists.There are some marketplaces that accept Bitcoin, but not many of them really get any traction and big popularity, most well know was Openbazaar with it's forks, and bitify.com (not p2p).One more peer-to-peer marketplace I found is called Bitejo.com, it is still in beta phase, and it doesn't have that much offers, but it exists.There are some rumors about ebay introducing Bitcoin payments, but we may need to wait more until this happens.EDIT:I found one Ebay clone called Ethair.com, but it is based on some shitcoin scheme, and I don't see much activity in their social media accounts.EDIT2:Try out shopinbit.com if you live in EU, they accept Bitcoin payments, and they have topic in bitcointalk forum:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5397142.0
